intro: Dracaena reflexa var. nitens, commonly known as the "Black Dracaena," is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its dark green, narrow leaves that often have a slight reddish tint along the edges. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that are followed by dark red berries. It is a hardy, low-maintenance plant that thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. Its striking appearance makes it a popular choice for indoor gardening and ornamental purposes.
